fields.name: KS3
fields.description: Key Stage 3 Computer Science - Building strong foundations in computing concepts, algorithms, and programming basics for Years 7-9.

fields.name: GCSE
fields.description: GCSE Computer Science (OCR J277) - Comprehensive preparation for both theory and programming components.

fields.name: A-Level
fields.description: A-Level Computer Science (OCR H446) - Advanced study covering complex algorithms, data structures, and programming project.

fields.name: Computer Science
fields.description: Comprehensive Computer Science tuition covering programming, algorithms, data structures, and computer systems.

fields.title: Computer Science
fields.description:
Build strong foundations in Computer Science with our KS3 course. Perfect for students in Years 7-9 who want to develop their understanding of computing concepts and programming skills.

This course covers the essential building blocks of Computer Science including algorithms, programming fundamentals, data representation, and an introduction to computer systems.
fields.learning_outcomes:
• Understand computational thinking and problem-solving
• Write programs in Python
• Work with algorithms including searching and sorting
• Understand how computers represent data
• Learn about computer networks and systems
• Develop debugging and testing skills
fields.prerequisites: No prior programming experience required. Basic maths skills helpful.

fields.title: Computer Science
fields.description:
Comprehensive GCSE Computer Science tuition following the OCR J277 specification. This course prepares you for both the theory exam (Component 01) and practical programming exam (Component 02).

With expert guidance from an OCR examiner, you'll gain deep understanding of computer systems, computational thinking, and programming skills needed to excel in your exams.
fields.learning_outcomes:
• Master Python programming for the practical exam
• Understand computer systems architecture
• Apply computational thinking to solve problems
• Work with algorithms and data structures
• Understand networks and cyber security
• Develop exam technique with insider knowledge
fields.prerequisites: KS3 Computer Science or equivalent foundation knowledge.

fields.title: Computer Science
fields.description:
Advanced A-Level Computer Science tuition following the OCR H446 specification. This rigorous course covers the full syllabus including Computer Systems (H446/01), Algorithms and Programming (H446/02), and Programming Project guidance (H446/03).

Benefit from tuition by an OCR examiner who knows exactly what's required to achieve top grades.
fields.learning_outcomes:
• Master advanced algorithms and data structures
• Develop complex programming skills in Python/Java
• Understand computer architecture at a deep level
• Apply mathematical concepts in computing
• Design and implement a programming project
• Perfect exam technique for A* grades
fields.prerequisites: GCSE Computer Science grade 6+ or strong programming foundation.

fields.title: Computer Systems
fields.description: Understanding how computer systems work, including CPU architecture, memory, storage, and systems software.

fields.title: Computational Thinking, Algorithms and Programming
fields.description: Problem-solving techniques, algorithm design, and programming in Python.

fields.title: Data Representation
fields.description: How computers store and process different types of data including numbers, text, images, and sound.

fields.title: Computer Networks
fields.description: Network types, protocols, security, and the internet.

fields.title: Components of a Computer
fields.description: Processor architecture, memory, storage devices, and I/O devices at an advanced level.

fields.title: Software and Software Development
fields.description: Systems software, applications, and software development methodologies.

fields.title: Data Types, Structures and Algorithms
fields.description: Advanced data structures including trees, graphs, and complex algorithms.

fields.title: Programming Project
fields.description: Guidance on designing, implementing, and documenting your A-Level programming project.
